result.execSummary:
The defendant James E Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentences.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentences.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other probation - Nunc Pro Tunc 12/02/15.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not have direct/indirect contact with C.A.C., except as approved by the probation agent for allowing contact in public places such as AA meetings and their son's swim events.

Provide a DNA sample if not already done. 
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Comply with AODA & comply with treatment recommendations and aftercare treatment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant James E Larson in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:36 a.m.  Court calls the case, states the appearances. 

Court reviews the file and a letter written by the victim requesting the no contact provision be modified. 
Court questions Atty Cousins. 
Court questions Mr. Larson. 
Atty Cousins makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions the defendant further. 

BY THE COURT: 
The Court will modify the JOC to say "No contact direct/indirect with C.A.C. except as approved by the probation agent for allowing contact in public places such as AA meetings and their son's swim events."
from C.C.
Sentence adjustment review on November 21, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant James E Larson in court with attorney John M Bliss. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:02 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Court has received a copy of a letter from Department of Corrections regarding the probation term running consecutive. 
Atty Constable makes recommendations to the Court. 
Atty Bliss makes recommendations to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
Court modifies the sentence from the stand point to make it legally correct, that the defendant will be placed on 3 years probation, concurrent rather than consecutive.  All other parts of the sentence to remain the same. 
Nunc Pro Tunc to 12/2/2015.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Sentencing hearing on April 5, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing at 04-05-2016 11:00 am

Defendant James E Larson not in court. Atty John Bliss not in Court.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:40 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Atty Constable states that Atty Bliss was not able to appear in Court today and that the defendant is in Milwaukee doing programming and not able to 
appear until March 2016.
Atty Constable requests an adjournment of the re-sentencing.
Court makes statements that the defendant could have appeared via telephone and that this is just a re-sentencing as per a letter filed
on December 16, 2015 by the DOC.
Court reviews the prior sentencing and makes statements.
Court questions Atty Constable how she wants to handle the re-sentencing; Atty Constable makes statements.
Atty Constable would prefer to do re-sentencing in March and have the defendant present in Court.
Defendant will be done with the program in March no dated indicating when his alcohol treatment program will end.

BY THE COURT:  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 11:00 am.
letter from DOC indicating that the probation as Ordered on Count 1 is not legal because this probationary term was ordered to run consecutively to any other probation
Hearing at 01-05-2016 10:30 am

Defendant James E Larson in court with attorney John M. Bliss. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent Sara Hohenstein appears. 

1:56 p.m.  Court calls case
Atty Constable states the appearances.
Court makes statements regarding the status of the case.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI from 09CF65.
Court questions probation agent and she provides her statement.
Court questions if the defendant is on probation or extended supervision; Probation Agent indicates he is on probation.
Probation Agent has found an alternative to the revocation to the probation of the defendant.
Probation Agent has been in contact with the State and Defendants Attorney.
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing.
Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing.
Defendant makes statements on his behalf prior to sentencing.
Court questions if victim notification had been completed and State indicates they had complied and that the victim did not want to appear
in Court today.
Court reviewed the PSI from 2009.
Defendant makes an additional statement to the Court.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 3 year prison sentence, consecutive to any other sentences.  1.5 years confinement and 1.5 years extended supervision
Placed on 3 years Probation consecutive to any other probation
Pay costs which includes the DNA Surcharge, Victim Witness Surcharge and Filing Fee 
Provide a DNA Sample if not already done.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
Comply with AODA & comply with treatment recommendations and aftercare treatment.
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  C.A.C. 
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.

Count 2 - DRI

**Defendant will be provided with the Written Determinate Sentence paperwork
Both parties will be keeping their PSI paperwork and are informed to keep this information confidential.

11:23 a.m. Defendant James E Larson in court with attorney John M. Bliss. Defendant James E Larson in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Prosecutor states plea agreement. Count 1: W/H Sentence: 3 yrs probation with conditions stated. Ct 2 to be DRI.

Defendant enters a plea of: Count 1 No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1 w/Repeaters.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. Count 2 is dimissed and read in.
